result.execSummary:
The defendant Deangelo J Burnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for Cancellation of Huber, signed and filed

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Witkowiak, Br 22, for review. os

Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Kimberly B.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 12 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 30 days condition time with good time credit and Huber.  Court stayed commencement until 06/19/2015 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $685.00 payable to Steven H; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Sentencing hearing, however due to court congestion case will need to adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Victim impact statement received and filed.

Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.
Filed: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Steven H.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant has been taken into custody.  Parties notified with dates for return on warrant in Branch 22.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued and bail forfeited.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea hearing, however Branch 22 is in jury trial.  Case adjourned for plea in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record and with the agreement of all parties, Plea Hearing adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for 09-22-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-09-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.
Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Randy Sitzberger for Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Steven H. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Deangelo J Burnett in custody.  Peter M. Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  ADA approves quick date. Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
